title: Intestinal absorption
description: Nutrient absorption occurs mostly in the small intestine. Processes annotated here include the uptake of dietary cholesterol and phytosterols, and of monosaccharides. Movement of the final products of digestion out of the intestinal lumen is mediated by arrays of transporters associated with the apical and basolateral surfaces of enterocytes (Yamada 2015).  View original pathway at [http://www.reactome.org/PathwayBrowser/#DIAGRAM=8963676 Reactome].
